Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here.Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.Who We Are…When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what’s next…From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.Warner Bros. Consumer Products (WBCP), extends the Studio’s powerful portfolio of entertainment brands and franchises into the lives of fans around the world. WBCP partners with best-in-class licensees globally on an award-winning range of toys, fashion, home décor, and publishing inspired by franchises and properties such as DC, Looney Tunes and Hanna-Barbera.The division’s successful global themed entertainment business includes groundbreaking experiences such as The Wizarding World of Harry Potter and Warner Bros. World Abu Dhabi. With innovative global licensing and merchandising programs, retail initiatives, promotional partnerships, and themed experiences, WBCP is one of the leading licensing and retail merchandising organizations in the world.To be successful at WBCP, you must have a willingness to model our values and behaviors, champion diversity and inclusion, leverage data and insights to maximize the legacy of our deep brands and franchises while maintaining a commitment to fostering best-in-class talent.Summary Of PositionThe Sr. Manager, Business Analytics will focus on managing and support leading the daily operations of the team, as well as the Business (Consumer Products and Retail Sales / Marketing) with quantitative and qualitative analysis to help further business initiatives, provide insights regarding retail opportunities and support financial analysis. This role will also be responsible for publishing weekly and monthly executive point-of-sale (POS) reports (and insights as needed) to each regional data analysis team/resource. This role will report into the Director, Global Business Analytics located in the Burbank office in California.Job ResponsibilitiesLeverages our internal retail revenue systems to provide accurate retail data to assist in growing the businessSupports the vision for our Product Information Master (PIM) to effectively enable product analyticsPartners with key account retailers to seamlessly transfer WB revenueDesigns, analyzes, and provides recommendations to support our product & franchise strategies at key accountsManages and leads the day-to-day global retail data operationsBuilds key stakeholder relationships (internal and external) to deliver department objectivesManages and leads the global expansion of retail analytics programMonitors sell-in and sell-thru performance from internal point-of-sale business dataPartners with sales teams and accounts to ensure key sales initiatives are achieved & develops annual targetsProvides inventory management support to ensure successful sell-thru and business opportunities are identifiedParticipates in joint planning sessions to grow our business together through data-informed decision-makingEvaluates and analyzes existing licensee performance to drive overall profitabilityDevelops and maintains feature placement and marketing reporting tools to ensure ROI alignmentAnalyzes account and market trends to provide competitive intelligence and impact on the marketBuilds and forecasts weekly retail seasonality curves based upon comp titlesLeads ad hoc projects, as requestedChampions fact-based selling to drive insight into action, while translating the data into powerful storiesDevelops compelling supporting materials for sales and marketing presentationsManages the production of regular and standard reports in support of key business objectivesResponsible for senior leadership updates / presentationsHandles other duties as assignedJOB QUALIFICATION STANDARDS Work ExperienceRetail/Consumer Products licensing experience requiredMinimum 7+ years of project management experience requiredMinimum 5+ years of retail analytics experience requiredEducation, Professional Training, Technical Training or CertificationBachelor’s degree in related field requiredMBA is a plusKnowledge/SkillsExcellent technical, analytical & organizational skillsExperience with systems such as Tableau, Power BI, etc.Experience in developing and reporting business performance metricsAdvanced PowerPoint skills, including ability to "tell a story" using PowerPointAdvanced Excel skills and knowledge of Access, Publisher, and One NoteExcellent written and verbal communication skillsOther RequirementsAbility to build strong working partnerships along with the ability to listen, understand, and influenceAbility to craft concise recommendations based on thorough business and market analysisAbility to communicate complex ideas and data graphically in an effective wayAbility to deliver on multiple assignments, meet tight deadlines and be effective and decisive under pressureAdaptability and flexibility to work well in a fast-paced, results-oriented, and rapidly changing environmentTeam player with interpersonal ability to work with others and collaborate to achieve goalsAbility to prioritize activities, manage timelines, and deal effectively with pressureAbility to take ownership of tasks and see them through to completionAbility to operate autonomouslyThis is a Project based positionManagement has the right to add or change duties and job requirements at any timeHow We Get Things Done…This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.The Legal Bits…In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. $83,090.00 - $154,310.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@warnermedia.com.
